![Снимок экрана от 2020-10-10 17-26-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26927187/95657703-9021f100-0b1e-11eb-8299-14405b7c7742.png)
Added a latency monitoring mechanism. Added building a mini report based on the java application log

Hello @ivandasch 

Let's divide improvements of `FailureHandler` and fixes of its usage.
I think we should keep the following changes in this PR:

1. Check that count of workers more than 1.
2. Print of the actual hanging thread.

And in other PR we should do the following:

1. Fix incorrect usage of `updateHeartbeat` near timely blocking calls like `selector.select`.
2. Print warning on the node start if the failure handler timeout value close to the other timeouts in code.

@nizhikov 
It's impossible to split PR.

- Since timeout is hardcoded, it's impossible to check failure handler without significantly increasing of blocking
thread check timeout. I suppose nobody wants to super long tests.
- The second suggestion is not possible to implement without refactor a huge codebase. 
- The second suggestion is not related to this issue.

I strongly disagree with splitting. Let's close my PR and leave things as it is.

@nizhikov 
Could you explain please, what's wrong that timeout of epoll_wait is 2000? It's common practice to sleep in epoll loop for few seconds. Why we should print warnings about this? If there is no events in socket, why we should wake up and consider this as failure? May be my knowledge about non-blocking IO is outdated and wrong?
Also, python check style is broken.

Hi Team, I have rebased the PR and resolved the conflicts. Can you please review the changes?

Hi, you have forgot to include your test to any suite.

Also, please make changes in `org.apache.ignite.internal.processors.cache.index.DynamicEnableIndexingConcurrentSelfTest`.
Because of this bug, usual `awaitPartitionMapExchange()` was changed to `awaitPartitionMapExchange(true, true, null)`.
Please, return back simple variant and remove `TODO`
Merged to master.
@dmagda , new doc improvement PR: https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/8452 . Please review. Didn't only manage to make a caution within the table.
LGTM, Waiting for Jenkins recheck.
@Vladsz83, should we encourage the developer to initialize the TcpCommunicationSpi.localAddresses as well? So that the nodes use only reachable network interfaces for communication needs.
Thank you @alamar

> @Vladsz83, should we encourage the developer to initialize the TcpCommunicationSpi.localAddresses as well? So that the nodes use only reachable network interfaces for communication needs.

We should encourage user to set `IgniteConfiguration.localHost`. This one is read buy other components. ZooKeeperSpi as an example. No reason to setup localAddress everywhere.
@sk0x50 LGTM

Hello, @SomeFire @timoninmaxim 

I looked at the PR.
Please, resolve comments.

We have `RunningQueryManager#register` method that tracks the running query, already.
Looks like `SqlQueryExecutionEvents` should be fired in the same places as the execution of this method.
But for not we have different usages of the methods.
Is it intentional? What is the rational behind it?
I think, additionally, we should enable a new event in the tests that check `RunningQueryManager` and ensure that all way to execute SQL query reflected in the event.

Hello, @SomeFire 
Can you, please, clarify the essence of the patch?
For what types of queries we want to fire events?
In what cases?
As I can see we have `CacheQueryExecutedEvent`, already. This event fired for an SQL query, also.

> RunningQueryManager is exactly the right place to implement it, this approach discussed on dev list

I not suggesting putting fire of the event inside of the RunningQueryManager.
All I'm said, firing of the event should be near the execution of RunningQueryManager methods.
Makes sense?

> But, as I remember, it does not invoke for some type of queries

For now, this patch contains only 1 usage of the new event - SQL query.
SQL query covered by the RunningQueryManager.

Yes, near is a correct word. I mean the same. 

> only 1 usage of the new event - SQL query

Yes, this is open question for me too, why do other type of queries skip. I mean is it conceptually correct to trigger event only for single type of queries? And this question is related to RunningQueryManager that does not track some queries too. @SomeFire @joooger could you please share you thoughts?

> I think, additionally, we should enable a new event in the tests that check `RunningQueryManager` and ensure that all way to execute SQL query reflected in the event.

I added query check in `UserQueriesTestBase` class.

> Looks like `SqlQueryExecutionEvents` should be fired in the same places as the execution of this method.

I moved event recording close to query registering.

@samaitra thanks! please proceed with the merge. Cherry-pick the commit to ignite-2.9-docs branch and ping me to update the docs on the website once the release happens.

> Some minor format issues that need to be changed.

fixed

> Refactor Java Thin Client to use GridNioServer in client mode:
> 
> * True non-blocking async
> * Worker threads are shared across connections within single `IgniteClient`
> 
> Benchmark results:
> 
> ```
> BEFORE (master)
> Benchmark                         Mode  Cnt      Score      Error  Units
> JmhThinClientCacheBenchmark.get  thrpt   10  65916.805 ± 2118.954  ops/s
> JmhThinClientCacheBenchmark.put  thrpt   10  62304.444 ± 2521.371  ops/s
> 
> AFTER (ignite-13496)
> Benchmark                         Mode  Cnt      Score      Error  Units
> JmhThinClientCacheBenchmark.get  thrpt   10  92501.557 ± 1380.384  ops/s
> JmhThinClientCacheBenchmark.put  thrpt   10  82907.446 ± 7572.537  ops/s
> ```

Great results! Good  (and expected by me) news that only one IO loop thread is enough to outperform traditional approach.
@dmagda thank you for the review, I have merged the changes and applied the cherry-pick commit to ignite-2.9-docs branch.
Better solution in: https://github.com/apache/ignite/pull/8484

Small advice -- run checkstyle locally, before push.
```
 mvn test-compile -Pall-java,licenses,lgpl,checkstyle,examples,all-scala,scala,check-licenses -B -V
```

> Are we sure that this is useful?

I and @kukushal have a request for a feature from one of the Ignite users that building an application that uses Java services from the DotNet platform.
